item.title: Engine Anti-Ice Valves – PW Valve Open

remarks.para: One may be inoperative locked open provided:

numlitem.para: Reduced Thrust or Derate operation is not permitted,
Improved climb performance operation is not permitted,
Anti-ice OFF thrust settings are reduced by the following EPR decrements:
PW All Thrust Settings:
Forecast ambient temperature cannot be greater than 38 degrees C,
Engine anti-ice is selected ON for affected engine during entire flight, and
Appropriate performance adjustments are applied.
Max Thrust required.
Do not use improved climb performance operation.
Observe MEL EPR decrements.
Observe reduced MEL takeoff and landing performance limited weight and obstacle clearance and en route climb limited performance weight.
Observe MEL V1 and VR increase.
Observe MEL ambient temperature requirements.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.

note.para: Disregard Associated Valve Light and EICAS message indications, if any.
Expect longer than normal engine start.

caution.para: IF THE TAI VALVE IS LOCKED OPEN FOR DISPATCH, THE VALVE SHOULD BE CLOSED DURING EXTENDED GROUND OPERATIONS WHEN THE ASSOCIATED PNEUMATIC DUCT IS PRESSURIZED BY THE APU OR GROUND CART AIR. REOPEN THE VALVE FOR DISPATCH AND DURING ENGINE START.

numlitem.para: Apply EPR decrement to all thrust settings.
Reduce Takeoff Runway Limit Weight by 14,600 lbs., if NOT OBSTACLE LIMITED.
Reduce Takeoff Runway Limit Weight by 22,400 lbs., if OBSTACLE LIMITED.
Reduce both Takeoff Climb Limit Weight and Climb Limit Weight for Landing by 14,600 lbs.
Land and Hold Short Operations (LAHSO) prohibited.
Reduce the ONE ENGINE INOPERATIVE NET EN ROUTE WEIGHT CAPABILITY found in Ch. 5.3 of the AOM by 22,400 lbs.
V1 and VR are increased by 1 knot, and
PW only: Limit operations to below 38°C ambient temperature.

placard.para: Placard appropriate Engine Anti-ice Switch "COWL VALVE INOP OPEN" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Also, placard the APU Bleed Valve Switch and Ground Air Cart Access Door Reference "CAUTION" Note on PW2000 Engine.

warning.para: TAG THRUST REVERSER LEVERS - "DO NOT OPERATE".

numlitem.para: Access engine inlet thermal anti-ice valve by opening the access panel on the appropriate engine.
For left engine, open access panel 414AR.
For right engine, open access panel 424AR.
Disconnect, cap and stow TAI valve connector.

note.para: Disconnecting the TAI valve connector will cause the associated engine anti-ice switch-light to remain illuminated for the duration of flight.

numlitem.para: Perform the following if desired valve position is closed.
Check that vane manual drive indicates valve CLOSED.
Pull vane lock out and rotate 90° clockwise to LOCK CLOSED position.
Perform the following if desired valve position is open.

caution.para: IF THE TAI VALVE IS LOCKED OPEN FOR DISPATCH, THE VALVE SHOULD BE CLOSED DURING EXTENDED GROUND OPERATIONS WHEN THE ASSOCIATED PNEUMATIC DUCT IS PRESSURIZED BY THE APU OR GROUND CART AIR. REOPEN THE VALVE FOR DISPATCH AND DURING ENGINE START.

numlitem.para: Check that vane manual drive indicates valve OPEN.
Pull vane lock out and rotate 90° counterclockwise to LOCK OPEN position.
Disregard associated VALVE light and EICAS message indications, if any.

graphic.title: MANUAL VALVE POSITIONING ENGINE INLET COWL TAI
